decks.notes: The main strategy of this deck is to use the powerful Bazaar of Baghdad to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures like Hollow One and Vengevine, enabling fast aggressive plays. With a high number of free counter spells like Force of Will and Force of Vigor, the deck aims to disrupt opposing strategies while maintaining its own momentum. By utilizing cards like Squee, Goblin Nabob and Master of Death for graveyard recursion, the deck can keep up the pressure on the opponent while maintaining card advantage.

The key concept of this deck is to use artifacts and fast mana acceleration to power out powerful spells like Paradoxical Outcome, Time Vault, and Yawgmoth's Will to generate a win condition quickly. It also utilizes card draw and control elements like Force of Will to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing you to cast cards from your graveyard and keep the pressure on your opponent. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently while balancing card advantage and disruption.
